reason: Strong institutional adoption of tokenized Real World Assets (RWAs) and increasing TradFi integration indicate significant potential for capital inflow. Regulatory clarity emerging from Hong Kong and potential favorable political tailwinds in the US further de-risk the asset class. While the introduction of perpetual contracts in Hong Kong will introduce more leverage and potential volatility, the overall market structure appears robust for sustained growth, making any dips opportune for accumulation.
headlines: Spark looks to build building a safe bridge between onchain capital and TradFi
Hong Kong working to allow perpetual contracts, chief regulator says
Institutions fuel tokenized RWA boom as retail looks set to follow suit
Solana's Lily Liu champions internet capital markets at Consensus Hong Kong 2026
SkyBridge's Scaramucci is buying the bitcoin dip, calls Trump a crypto President
